intro: Brassica millecapitata, commonly known as the African mustard or wild mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruits are long, slender siliques that contain numerous small seeds. Brassica millecapitata is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
